edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_3.Engine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_3.Engine.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The engine of the game, which processes input, keeps track of states, and interfaces with the UI.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start(IGameUI ui)
                  throws GameStateException
        Starts the game. A new engine is created given a user interface to send and receive input and results.
        Parameters:
        ui -
        Throws:
        GameStateException

      • enterLoop

        private void enterLoop()
                throws GameStateException
        Executes the main game loop. The loop will do three things in order: 1. Request input from the user via the interface. 2. Process that input based on the game state. This is where game logic will be executed. 3. Request that the interface update to reflect the current game state.
        Throws:
        GameStateException

      • processInput

        private void processInput(java.lang.String input)
                   throws GameStateException
        Processes input based on the state of the game.
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        GameStateException

      • processShootingInput

        private void processShootingInput(java.lang.String input)
        Process input in the shooting state. Input is a cardinal direction to shoot. After input has been processed, the player's turn is over and ninjas are moved.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processPostGameInput

        private void processPostGameInput(java.lang.String input)
        Processes input in the post game state. This can occur if the player won or lost.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processMenuInput

        private void processMenuInput(java.lang.String input)
        Processes input in the menu state. The input allows the user to choose what they would like to do.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processPlayingInput

        private void processPlayingInput(java.lang.String input)
        Processes input in the playing state. This lets the user choose an option to execute in their turn.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processLookingInput

        private void processLookingInput(java.lang.String input)
        Processed input in the looking state. The input represents a cardinal direction.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processMoveInput

        private void processMoveInput(java.lang.String input)
        Moves the player according to user input and then moves n i n j a s randomly from processMoveNinja().

      • consumeInvincibility

        private void consumeInvincibility()
        Decrements the invincibility turns if possible. If there are no turns remaining, the player is set to be no longer invincible.

      • checkNinjaCollisions

        private boolean checkNinjaCollisions()
        Checks to see if ninjas are adjacent to the player and can kill him. If so, states are updated.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a ninja can kill the player, false otherwise.

      • checkRoomVictory

        private boolean checkRoomVictory()
        Checks if the player is in a room with a briefcase.
        Returns:

      • processMoveNinjas

        private void processMoveNinjas()
        Moves enemy players to random positions on the grid.

      • removeFromArray

        private Enemy[] removeFromArray(Enemy[] arr,
                                Enemy obj)
        Removes an enemy from an array of enemies and returns the new resulting array.
        Parameters:
        arr -
        obj -
        Returns:

      • resetTickFlags

        private void resetTickFlags()
        Sets turn flags to a default value at the beginning of each turn.

      • resetGame

        private void resetGame()
        Resets all game objects and creates a new randomized game board.

      • resetRooms

        private void resetRooms()
        Initiates all the possible rooms on the grid. One random room will be selected to have the briefcase. That room will have its hasBriefcase boolean value set to true.

      • resetEnemies

        private void resetEnemies()
        Adds enemies to valid random locations. The coordinates are first randomized then checked for validity through validSpawn method in grid class. If valid = returned true, they will be assigned created to the grid. Otherwise, a new pair of coordinates are randomized until a valid location is found.

      • resetPowerups

        private void resetPowerups()
        Adds power ups to valid random locations. The coordinates are first randomized then checked for validity through validSpawn method in grid class. If valid = returned true, they will be assigned to the grid. Otherwise, a new pair of coordinates are randomized until a valid location is found.

      • tryUsePowerUp

        public void tryUsePowerUp()
        Uses a power up if one exists on the same space the player does, and removes it from the grid.

      • createGameSaveObj

        private GameSave createGameSaveObj()
        Creates a GameSaveObject based on the current state of the GameEngine.
        Returns:

      • loadGame

        private void loadGame(java.lang.String filename)
               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Loads a saved game and sets engine states and fields.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • processSaveInput

        private void processSaveInput(java.lang.String input)
        Processes input in the save state. The input string should be a filename.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • processLoadInput

        private void processLoadInput(java.lang.String input)
        Process input in the load state. The input string should be a filename.
        Parameters:
        input -
